attribs.name: repeating_traits_-OGbOGHhXBl-2cFbI5OA_description
attribs.current: Thanks to your elf blood, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-OGbOGHhXBl-2cFbI5OB_description
attribs.current: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-OGbON9NPoUTQxxwKgju_description
attribs.current: You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-OGbOznHbeEg0g2DXTsv_description
attribs.current:
When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

Maneuvers. You learn three maneuvers of your choice. Many maneuvers enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one maneuver per attack. You learn two additional maneuvers of your choice at 7th, 10th, and 15th level. Each time you learn new maneuvers, you can also replace one maneuver you know with a different one.

Superiority Dice. You have four superiority dice, which are d8s. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest. You gain another superiority die at 7th level and one more at 15th level.

Saving Throws. Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

Maneuver save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice)

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-OGbP5myhi4U0Ye35Igx_description
attribs.current: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with one type of artisan's tools of your choice.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-OGbPZZh0Vudy3OkJIHU_description
attribs.current:
Starting at 2nd level, you can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional action.

Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. Starting at 17th level, you can use it twice before a rest, but only once on the same turn.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-OGg6M2NhK3ZSsvw-Ux6_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Longbow
Ranged weapon (martial, longbow)  Ammunition. You can use a weapon that has the Ammunition property to make a Ranged Attack only if you have Ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you Attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of Ammunition. Drawing the Ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the Attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended Ammunition by taking a minute to Search the Battlefield.  If you use a weapon that has the Ammunition property to make a melee Attack, you treat the weapon as an Improvised Weapon. A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.  Heavy. Small creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls with heavy weapons. A heavy weapon's size and bulk make it too large for a Small creature to use effectively.  Range. A weapon that can be used to make a ranged attack has a range in parentheses after the ammunition or thrown property. The range lists two numbers. The first is the weapon’s normal range in feet, and the second indicates the weapon’s long range. When attacking a target beyond normal range, you have disadvantage on the attack roll. You can’t attack a target beyond the weapon’s long range.  Two-Handed. This weapon requires two hands when you attack with it.
  Damage: 1d8
Damage Type: Piercing
Properties: Ammunition, Heavy, Range, Two-Handed
Range: 150/600
Weight: 2

attribs.current: Item Type: Ranged Weapon, Damage: 1d8, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 150/600

attribs.name: character_backstory
attribs.current:
Em uma manhã de neblina nas profundezas de uma antiga floresta, onde o sussurro das árvores contava histórias esquecidas, um ferreiro humano chamado Tarō encontrou um bebê meio-elfo abandonado. Com um coração gentil e espírito nobre, Tarō acolheu a criança como seu próprio filho, nomeando-o Musashi.

Tarō era conhecido por sua bondade e generosidade. Ele acolheu Musashi com um coração caloroso e amoroso, proporcionando ao menino um lar cheio de carinho. Porém, quando se tratava de treinamentos, Tarō se transformava. Na forja, ele era implacável, exigindo perfeição em cada golpe de martelo e cada centelha de metal incandescente. Da mesma forma, nos treinamentos de combate com katanas, ele era rigoroso e incansável, insistindo que Musashi alcançasse a maestria.

Musashi, por sua vez, era bem-humorado e brincalhão. Sempre com um sorriso no rosto, ele adorava pregar peças e contar piadas, muitas vezes não levando a sério os ensinamentos de vida de Tarō. Mesmo assim, ele tinha um talento natural para a forja e o combate, o que muitas vezes deixava seu mestre intrigado e impressionado. 

À medida que Musashi crescia, ele absorvia o conhecimento de Tarō sobre metais e lâminas, assim como as técnicas de combate dos samurais. Em um momento de confiança, Tarō revelou a Musashi seu passado como um samurai renomado e um aventureiro destemido. Ele acreditava que essas habilidades seriam inestimáveis no futuro de Musashi.

Conforme os anos se passaram, Musashi se tornou um guerreiro habilidoso, mas Tarō guardava um segredo sombrio. Ele finalmente revelou a Musashi que seu isolamento não era por acaso: escondia uma arma amaldiçoada, temida e desejada por muitos. No entanto, Tarō não deu mais detalhes sobre a natureza da maldição ou sobre a origem da arma.

Em um fatídico dia, Musashi partiu para uma caçada na floresta. Ao retornar, encontrou seu mestre morto e a arma amaldiçoada desaparecida. Tomado pela dor e pela vontade de entender majs, Musashi decidiu encontrar o responsável pela morte de Tarō e recuperar a arma, enfrentando quaisquer perigos que surgissem em seu caminho.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-OGgQG6xtld6R7i2z2xa_description
attribs.current: When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend one superiority die to make a melee weapon attack against the creature. If you hit, you add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-OGgQPKp9qTQH6Hxs5Ve_description
attribs.current: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to knock the target down. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you knock the target prone.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-OGgQfIzXj8b-UZy9x-o_description
attribs.current: When you make a weapon attack roll against a creature, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the roll. You can use this maneuver before or after making the attack roll, but before any effects of the attack are applied.
